intro: Physospermopsis rubrinervis, commonly known as the red-veined physosperm, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, vividly colored leaves with prominent red veins. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually come in shades of pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
